intro: Psychotria hospitalis, commonly known as the "hospital plant," is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. The plant's name is believed to originate from its traditional use in indigenous medicine for treating ailments.
